channel.title: Need help whit compiler :(
channel.description:
[code]javac: file not found: *.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options Finished! Druk op een toets om door te gaan. . .[/code]
this came up when i use a compiler i found somewhere en if u se this: [code]@echo off Title Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0\bin\javac.exe" *.java pause [/code]
this cam up-.-: The device is not ready. Press any key to continue. . .
en i little time ago i can compile whit the 2th !!!!! what is the prob that it don't work anymore i don't did a shit to it :(

item.title: Need help whit compiler :(
item.dc:creator: @Beasty_x Beasty_x
item.description:
@Beasty_x wrote:

[quote="`Java, post:4, topic:248657"]when this happens to me, I go into the jdk/jre folder, (whichever contains javac) make a copy of it, then paste it into the your server folder. either that or change the path.

Or you don’t have the correct java.[/quote] i use this normaly @echo off cd Source "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0\bin\javac.exe" -cp . -d ./Bin/ ./*java pause en it normaly works but now this alwase came up The device is not ready. Press any key to continue. . . en like i set i try oter compilets en they don’t wotk PS: i use Richscape source for this en i use this source ofr pritty long time en it alwase work so what can be wrong that it now don’t work anymore !..

Read full topic

item.title: Need help whit compiler :(
item.dc:creator: @_Java6 `Java
item.description:
@_Java6 wrote:

when this happens to me, I go into the jdk/jre folder, (whichever contains javac) make a copy of it, then paste it into the your server folder. either that or change the path.

Or you don’t have the correct java.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help whit compiler :(
item.dc:creator: @Beasty_x Beasty_x
item.description:
@Beasty_x wrote:

Is there something wrong whit my java then?

Read full topic

item.title: Need help whit compiler :(

item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

It can’t find any .java files.
